channel.title: Csv-to-geojsons on Introduction to mapping and spatial methods for the humanities
channel.description: Recent content in Csv-to-geojsons on Introduction to mapping and spatial methods for the humanities

item.title: CSV to GeoJSON
item.description: Overview Geographic clues can be hidden in all kinds of documents. In this exercise, we’ll collect addresses from the 1890-1891 Ottawa Directory. Library and Archives Canada has digitized 95 microfiche versions of pre-1901 Canadian directories. These are useful resources for researching where people and businesses were located (and the ads are pretty cool too). The following exercise will require a Google account. Data files Google Sheet with template PDF of the Ottawa Directory from 1890-1891 Installing the geocoder add-on If you haven’t already, log into your Google account.
